The '''Spiralling Serial Spheres''' is a double-handed version of the regular Rasengan.

== Usage ==
The user creates two [[Rasengan]], one in each of their hands. The user can then either attack two targets at once,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 558</ref> or attack the same target with both Rasengan.<ref name="c432"/>

== Senjutsu Influence ==
[[File:Spiralling serial spheres.png|thumb|left|Sage Technique: Spiralling Serial Spheres.]]
When in [[Sage Mode]], the user can use a [[senjutsu]]-enhanced version known as {{translation|'''Sage Technique: Spiralling Serial Spheres'''|仙術・螺旋連丸|Senjutsu: Rasenrengan|engtv=Sage Jutsu: Rasengan Barrage}}. It is fundamentally the same as the normal version, except stronger.<ref name="c432">''Naruto'' chapter 432</ref>

== Trivia ==
* [[Jiraiya]] performed this as a visual aid to teaching Naruto the Rasengan; in one hand he forms a regular Rasengan, and in the other he does within the balloon exercise.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 155</ref>
* When Naruto performs this technique in ''[[Naruto the Movie: Legend of the Stone of Gelel]]'', he uses two different versions of the Rasengan: the [[Gelel Rasengan]] and the [[Rasengan#Nine-Tails Influence|Demon Fox Rasengan]]. In this movie, he calls it {{translation|"Twin Rasengan"|ツイン螺旋丸|Tsuin Rasengan|lit meaning=Twin Spiralling Spheres}}.
* In ''[[The Last: Naruto the Movie]]'', in his fight against [[Toneri Ōtsutsuki]] on the moon, Naruto was shown holding dual Rasengan to block attacks, instead of thrusting them onto the opponent.
